subject: Instantiated TestCase won't run tests
msgSnippet: I just wrote my first TestCase class. Lets call it MyTestCase. It works great by itself. It fakes some data that it will need, then runs through some tests to
messageBody:
I just wrote my first TestCase class. Lets call it MyTestCase. It works great by
itself. It fakes some data that it will need, then runs through some tests to
make sure everything works right. Great!
Now what I want to do is instantiate MyTestCase from another TestCase and have
it run through the tests. The reason that I want to do this is because the other
TestCase (lets call it AnotherTestCase) is going to feed it the fake data that I
want. The reason that I want be able to do this because by default I want
MyTestCase to run on it's own fake data with the regular constructor, but I also
want the option to have a list of fake data that I can feed MyTestCase one at a
time so that I test all elements in the list. So I want to call it externally
and instantiate it with each element in the list, and run the tests on that
instance. I have made a special constructor on MyTestCase for loading the fake
data. Below is the code that I would think that I could put in a test method of
AnotherTestCase and have it run the tests of MyTestCase on my instance.

Just for clarification this might be in a loop where I iterate through the list
and pull out each piece of "FakeData." But the whole list thing is only
mentioned because that is the reason that I am trying to run tests on a specific
instance in the first place.

TestCase ts = new MyTestCase(FakeData);
ts.run();

But when I execute this code it executes these lines, but ts.run() does not
cause the tests in MyTestCase to run. The Setup() of MyTestCase runs, but no
tests. What is run used for then, and how do I do what I am trying to do? Even
using the regular constructor no tests are run.

I've seen two close solutions posted everywhere, but neither fits my needs:

I've seen that I can set up a static suite method in MyTestCase. When I do this
I can run the tests, but not on the specific MyTestCase that I instantiated. I
want to run the tests for this specific instance that I created. The run() is
after all an instance method. I can't find any information about how to do this.
I must be thinking about this wrong.

I have seen where I can overwrite runTest() in MyTestCase and put all the tests
in there that I want to run. Sure it runs the tests from the instance that I
populated with fake data, but there are three big problems with this.
* I hate the idea of having to modify runTest() if I add or remove methods. I
like the reflection where anything named test* runs. This should be how it
works automatically. But I can only figure out how to make this run from a test
suite that you instantiate with a class object. I can't run my instances that way.
* The tests actually run, but setup is only called before the whole group of
tests. Setup and tear down are supposed to run before and after EACH test. So
overriding runTest() in this way is actually breaking the rules of how the tests
are expected to run. For this reason alone I don't think that anyone should
ever override runTest() in this way. Sure you can actually put the setup and
tear down method calls before and after each test method call. But come on,
what happened to having all my tests run automatically by reflection!?!
* The output of the tests is not displayed, it is lost, and the test output is
only about the one that is run from AnotherTestCase. There may be some way to
redirect this. I see how I can get the test results from the run method. But I
don't know what to do with it.

In summary, I just want to send some data to an instance of a TestCase subclass,
and run the tests on it. This should be trivial. What do I need to do?

Help would be greatly appreciated.
Thanks
